data.title: Colored Bitmap Fonts (Feature request)
UI_ROOT->CreateChild<DropDownList>() hide all interface
Input scaling between backbuffer / window
data.body:
Scales mouse position and deltas if backbuffer (Graphics) has different size than SDL window. Inspired by work of Elissa Ross in PR #1725. Related to issue #1252, might resolve it, but not tested on actual Retina hardware.

For code simplicity, this now applies scale always, even if it's (1,1). Involves somewhat horrible int-float-int conversions. If anyone has time, please review so that I didn't commit too bad sins. I tested in D3D9 by intentionally creating half sized or double sized backbuffer, and it seemed to work right.

data.title: Allow define of variant vector structs attributes
data.body:
See issue #1741 .
Now variant vector structs elements names can be defined from AttributeInfos. Now AnimatedModel, CrowdManager, SplinePath, BilboardSet and StaticModelGroup use this way to do it.

data.title: [Feature Request] Allow to define vector structs for editor for external components.
data.body: In Urho3DEditor, editing of structures such as animation states (in AnimatedModel) and billboards (in BillboardSet) implemented using special vector structs (See lines 1490-1579 in Scripts/Editor/AttributeEditor.as). This mechanism works fine for engine components, but it can't be used for external components (special game components, Unit for example). In my opinion, it will be good to move this structures definitions into AttributeInfos (for easy defining them in external components).

data.title: Style not update after UIElement::AddChild
Avoid special chars in paths in MRI script passed to ar utility
data.body:
I have run into issue with MRI script special characters when building inside my "projects/c++/" directory.

Seems like not only spaces are problematic and no escaping is available.
https://sourceware.org/binutils/docs/binutils/ar-scripts.html

> The syntax for the ar command language is straightforward:
...
>     comments are allowed; text after either of the characters `*' or `;' is ignored.
...
>     Whenever you use a list of names as part of the argument to an ar command, you can separate the individual names with either commas or blanks. Commas are shown in the explanations below, for clarity.
...
>     `+' is used as a line continuation character; if `+' appears at the end of a line, the text on the following line is considered part of the current command. 

In case I understand it correctly no space, '+', '*', ';' or ',' should be allowed in script passed to ar.

data.title: UI_ROOT->SetLayoutMode(LM_VERTICAL) error
clangformat Style
data.body:
I've been using this `.clang-format` style in Visual Studio. Maybe we should import it into the root directory. Clang format is a method of automatically formatting code to a style.

```
Language:        Cpp
BasedOnStyle:  LLVM
IndentWidth:     4
TabWidth:        4
UseTab:          Never
Standard:        Cpp11
BreakBeforeBraces: Allman
PointerAlignment: Left
AccessModifierOffset: -4
AllowShortFunctionsOnASingleLine: None
ColumnLimit: 0
SpacesInAngles: true
```

Been using http://llvm.org/builds/ 's http://llvm.org/pre-releases/win-snapshots/ClangFormat-r288665.vsix

Anyone else use clang format? What do you think of this style?

data.title: question: 	<component type="AnimatedModel"> on save
data.body:
Why does it have to save:
 * "Bone Animation Enabled" attributes when they're all defaulted to true
 * and all bone nodes
when these are automatically generated when an AnimatedModel is created at run time.

Currently, I'm having to manually edit my scene file to remove them but would be more efficient and would decrease my scene file size if there's an option to not save them.

data.title: Rename Resource::Load and Resource::Save filename overloads to Resourâ€¦
data.body:
â€¦ce::LoadFile and Resource::SaveFile to prevent Resource::Save shadowing.

I noticed this annoying behaviour with my new Resource functions.
When some resource overrides Resource::Save(Serializer&), Resource::Save(String) became shadowed and inaccessible. So I renamed these functions in C++ API. Script APIs remain untouched because such functions are quite old and scripts don't have shadowing problems.

data.title: Console auto complete
data.body:
Console auto complete feature.

Didn't include binding for Lua.

data.title: 06_SkeletalAnimatin: fix running out bounds, lighting correction
Add missing namespace prefix in URHO3D_ACESSOR_ATTRIBUTE, URHO3D_ACESSOR_ATTRIBUTE_FREE, URHO3D_MIXED_ACESSOR_ATTRIBUTE and URHO3D_MIXED_ACESSOR_ATTRIBUTE_FREE.
data.body:
Namespace prefix before AttributeTraits (Urho3D::) missing in these macros. It doesn't affect engine build process, but can cause errors like 'AttributeTrait was not declared in this scope' in downstream projects.
UPD: Sorry for huge title.

data.title: replaced Jack with Jill in 06_SkeletalAnimation sample
(feature request) Variant::GetTypeFromName to AngelScript
Fix minor Terrain bugs.
data.body:
- Missing include added.
- Terrain UV coordinates fixed.

The image below shows how UV coordinates currently go in the place where one Terrain object changes to another. This PR fixes it.

![terrain fix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3167494/21484533/ca8e9ade-cb9c-11e6-9021-90bb7f46eb55.jpg)

data.title: Update AngelScript
data.body:
AngelScript 2.31.2 released.
Fixed bug with saved byte code not being portable between 32bit and 64bit platforms.
And more...
http://angelcode.com/angelscript/changes.php

data.title: Errors generating Lua bindings on MinGW
data.body:
Doing a fresh build on a new Win10 laptop.

Checked out latest source and invoked MinGW build with:

cmake_mingw.bat ../Urho3D-GL -DURHO3D_OPENGL=1 -DURHO3D_LUAJIT=1 -DURHO3D_64BIT=1 -DMINGW_SYSROOT="C:\Program Files\mingw-w64\x86_64-6.2.0-posix-seh-rt_v5-rev1\mingw64"

Configuration process works as expected, but build fails upon calling tolua++ to generate the binding code for the LuaScript module. Fails on every module (Audio, etc...) with errors similar to:

http://pastebin.com/idrfbrLA

All attempts to generate the Lua bindings fail in this fashion, and compilation fails when attempting to build the LuaScript generated files since they don't exist.


Edit: Looks like the problem only exists for the LuaJIT build. Building with vanilla Lua works okay.

data.title: playing a footstep sound on a fixed periodic timer tends to slip/overlap
data.body:
I first noticed this when I created a footstep sound on a characters and noticed that the sound was not periodic as expected; sometimes it was then it slip/overlap then periodic, and repeat.  For ease of verifying this bug I modified the 14_SoundEffects to play a sound on a periodic, 300 msec timer.  You'll notice when the duration goes over 100 msec or when it hits 5 msec that the sound becomes non-periodic.

You can also hear this slip/overlap in this guys video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tonig94XWsY

[14_SoundEffects.zip](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/files/671399/14_SoundEffects.zip)

data.title: Proposed fix for Issue #1252: mouse scaling on Retina displays
data.body:
I've added some code to address the mouse position issues on Retina displays with HighDPI enabled (issue #1252). This fix works for our purposes but there may be other places where the issue comes up that I haven't encountered. 

Regarding the UI scaling, we find that with HighDPI enabled on OSX the UI should be scaled at about 1.5X. This is possible using the Scale() functionality.

data.title: Some plug-in system? (feature request)
data.body:
In cryengine user's code compiled in separate dll, that can by loadede by sandbox (Editor) and by game launcher. So if user write own class in c++, he can edit own project in editor, use own classes, run project and it will be work.

In urho currently if user add own class to game project, he can not use it in edior. It should be added to modified version of engine. 

It would be convenient, that user can compile own game to dll and use it with standart version of engine

data.title: New logo
data.body:
Cropped the black and white logo (svg) and placed it at the top of the readme.
Also I replaced the logo in the sample (png) with the one with colour again. Could it _pretty please_ stay there? I really like how it turned out, goes on all backgrounds and has some colour of the previous logo (and Ogre) in it.
![Just look at that](http://luckeyproductions.nl/images/LogoCompare.png)

data.title: How to integrate a Urho3D scene into a UIKit app
data.body:
Hi, and thanks for Urho3D.
I'm looking for the best way to integrate a 3D scene view inside a plain UIKit app. 
That would allow me, for example, opening a list of 3D model names in a UITableView, and launch the 3D view when the user selects one.
Can I do that with Urho3D? If so, how can I do that?

Thanks!
